thread.title: Coyotes go cold in 3rd period, lose 4th straight
thread.title_full: Coyotes go cold in 3rd period, lose 4th straight

title: Coyotes go cold in 3rd period, lose 4th straight
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Coyotes go cold in 3rd period, lose 4th straight AP-HKN--Coyotes-RangersLundqvist, Hayes lead Rangers to 4-1 win over CoyotesEds: APNewsNow. Rangers 4, Coyotes 1. With AP Photos.By DENIS P. Post to Facebook Coyotes go cold in 3rd period, lose 4th straight AP-HKN--Coyotes-RangersLundqvist, Hayes lead Rangers to 4-1 win over CoyotesEds: APNewsNow. Rangers 4, Coyotes 1. With AP Photos.By DENIS P.   12news.com: http://12ne.ws/1LQnnoz   Join the Conversation To   Coyotes go cold in 3rd period, lose 4th straight AP 7:07 p.m. MST October 22, 2015 Oct 22, 2015; New York, NY, USA; New York Rangers center Dominic Moore (28) and Arizona Coyotes center Martin Hanzal (11) fight during the first period of an NHL hockey game at Madison Square Garden. Mandatory Credit: Adam Hunger-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Adam Hunger, Adam Hunger-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT 7 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
NEW YORK (AP) - Henrik Lundqvist made 34 saves and Kevin Hayes scored the tiebreaking goal early in the third period to lift the New York Rangers to a 4-1 victory over the Arizona Coyotes on Thursday. Chris Kreider, Keith Yandle and Rick Nash also scored goals for New York. Nash's goal was his 700th career point. Mats Zuccarello added two assists. Klas Dahlbeck scored for Arizona. The Coyotes have lost four in a row after opening the season 3-0. Mike Smith made 24 saves for Arizona. Hayes broke a 1-1 tie with his second goal of the season at 2:35 of the third period. Smith turned the puck over to J.T. Miller trying to play the puck behind the goal line. Miller found Hayes along the goal line, and the second year center lifted a backhand into the net.
